title: How to Open Task Scheduler in Windows 10

steps.headline: Launch it via the Windows search.
steps.description:
Click the search bar/icon on the taskbar. If it's missing, then click on the Start {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

I edited this screenshot of a Windows icon.\n<\/p>

License: Public Domain<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} button. Type task scheduler. Hit the ↵ Enter key or select the matching result.

steps.headline: Run it via the Run dialog window.
steps.description:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7e\/Taskschd.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7e\/Taskschd.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":237,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":392.3809523809524,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Press the ⊞ Win+R keyboard keys at the same time. Type taskschd.msc. Hit the ↵ Enter key or click OK.

steps.headline: Use the All Apps list in the Start menu.
steps.description:
The Start menu contains a list of all software installed on your PC. Task Scheduler is hidden under the "Windows Administrative Tools" folder of the list. Click on the Start {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

I edited this screenshot of a Windows icon.\n<\/p>

License: Public Domain<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} button. Open the All apps list from the left of the Start menu (or scroll if you've configured it to show on the tiles page). Click the "Windows Administrative Tools" folder. Choose "Task Scheduler".

steps.headline: Start it from Control Panel.
steps.description: Press ⊞ Win+R together, type control admintools, and hit ↵ Enter. Open "Task Scheduler" from the list of tools.

steps.headline: Use Command Prompt.
steps.description:
To launch Task Scheduler via the Command Prompt, follow these instructions: Open Command Prompt. One way is to right-click the Start {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

I edited this screenshot of a Windows icon.\n<\/p>

License: Public Domain<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} button and click Command Prompt. Type control schedtasks. Hit ↵ Enter.

sentences: Launch it via the Windows search.
Click the search bar/icon on the taskbar.

If it's missing, then click on the Start {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} button.
Type task scheduler.
Hit the ↵ Enter key or select the matching result.
Run it via the Run dialog window.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7e\/Taskschd.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7e\/Taskschd.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":237,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":392.3809523809524,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Press the ⊞ Win+R keyboard keys at the same time.
Type taskschd.msc.
Hit the ↵ Enter key or click OK. Use the All Apps list in the Start menu.
The Start menu contains a list of all software installed on your PC.
Task Scheduler is hidden under the "Windows Administrative Tools" folder of the list.

Click on the Start {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} button.
Open the All apps list from the left of the Start menu (or scroll if you've configured it to show on the tiles page).
Click the "Windows Administrative Tools" folder.
Choose "Task Scheduler".
Start it from Control Panel.
Press ⊞ Win+R together, type control admintools, and hit ↵ Enter.
Open "Task Scheduler" from the list of tools.
Use Command Prompt.

To launch Task Scheduler via the Command Prompt, follow these instructions:

Open Command Prompt.
